DataElement.preferredName: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer Additional Pathologic Finding Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication as to whether additional pathologic findings are documented in the patient's medical record.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Carcinoma Additional Pathologic Finding Identification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma that arises from the hepatocytes or intrahepatic bile ducts.  The main subtypes are hepatocellular carcinoma (hepatoma) and cholangiocarcinoma._Added; extra; further._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease._The procedure of having an identity established.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Liver and Intrahepatic Biliary Tract Carcinoma
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disease in which malignant (cancer) cells are found in the tissues of the liver.

Concepts.longName: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Carcinoma
Concepts.definition: A carcinoma that arises from the hepatocytes or intrahepatic bile ducts.  The main subtypes are hepatocellular carcinoma (hepatoma) and cholangiocarcinoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Added; extra; further.:Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.:The procedure of having an identity established.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.
The procedure of having an identity established.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for HCC and Bile Duct Cancer CDE request 8.16.18 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves
